answers.answer: Hi.  Yes, I had this SO bad when I was pregnant with my 5 month old. I dont want to scare you but, I had it bad.  And boy it was the absolute worse part of my pregnancy. I can take everything else.  Heck, I'll even do labor again (with the epidural of course) then have that carpal tunnel again.  That is how horrible it was.  I would wake up in the middle of the night in absolute agony and crying because my hands had gotten so numb that it ached. I slept with a wrist guard on both hands in order to keep them straight so that the blood would flow properly.  Didnt help much.  I got it in the late stages of my pregnancy.  There is nothing that they can do for you.  It's something in your wrist that swells and causes less blood to flow through. Its hard enough trying to sleep when your huge but, it's even worse trying to sleep with your hands propped up on pillows while sleeping on your right side. My poor BF.  I couldnt even hold my friends baby because I would go numb and I was afraid to drop her.I would wake up in the middle of the night to put my hand under cold water so that the swelling inside would reduce. It helped a little but only temporarily.  I'm sorry that I'm not much help but, there isnt anything the dr can do. You just have to deal with it until your baby is here. So sorry.

i had it bad too, started in one but ended having it in both wrists. woke me frequently at night, and towards the end i couldn't carry things either. good news is it disappeared after she was born. my feet also got huge, but i ended up with preeclampsia.

Thank you both for your help.  I work with two year olds and it is hard when I get that pain to keep going.  I think my feet pain is from new shoes.  I don't think I got very good ones, went to BOGO at payless, LOL.  I can't wait for the colder weather so I can switch to my uggs, although the hought of heat drives me crazy!!!  Oh well it will all be worth it in th eend.  Thanks again for your help.
